item.description:
Try navigating with a map and compass to find a series of checkpoints in lovely College Woods. Similar to a treasure hunt, in orienteering you locate orange/white flags in the woods whose exact location is shown on a premarked detailed topographic map.
Several courses of differing navigational challenge and lengths will be offered.
All ages are welcome! A great sport for the entire family!
You may start individually or in teams.  You may try to run fast or simply do a map hike. Instructions provided for those who need it.

I'm not doing a formal map and compass workshop this year, but I will be at registration all day and can give instructions, and help people chose a course. You are welcome to come and be matched with others if you want to go out in a group.

Specifics:
Location: Gregg Hall (see directions below)
Starts between 10am - 1pm; come at 10:00 am if you need instructions.
Cost: $5 to $8 depending on course chosen
Courses offered:
White (beginner)
Yellow (advanced beginner)
Orange (intermediate)
Brown, Green, Red (advanced, vary by distance)
Map: 1:10,000, contour interval 3 meters, standard orienteering map.
Event Directors: Faye Doria
email: fayedoria@yahoo.com
See also www.upnoor.org

Directions to the event:
From Route 4, exit at Route 155A (UNH - Whittemore Center). Turn towards Durham (Whittemore Center) and travel 1.2 miles straight on that road to the UNH Campus. At the traffic light after the tennis courts and railroad overpass, take a right onto College Road and travel 0.3 miles. Turn right onto South Drive, and after the RR underpass, follow signs for orienteering. Park only in designed spots.

Google Map Coordinates:
43.135019,-70.938163

Google Map Directions
http://maps.google.com/maps?f=d&source=s_d&saddr=New+Hampshire+155A%2FMain+St%2FOld+Concord+Turnpike&daddr=43.134925,+-70.938501&hl=en&geocode=Fc1WkgIdiVDF-w%3BFc0vkgIde5DF-w&mra=...
item.name: Orienteering Event
